page.title: 07GREENHALGH WITH ESPRICK
page.content: These are two villages intermingled with houses on each side of Fleetwood Road. There are many types of houses, from the old traditional handmade brick and slate roof style, to chalet types with high pitched tile roofs. In Esprick quite a few bungalows have been built in recent years of which most are detached. The farmhouses here are much smaller than most Fylde farmhouses implying that previously there were more smallholdings in this area. The old village school and school house here have found a new use since closure about ten years ago. The house has been very tastefully restored retaining a lot of its traditional external architecture. The school now has a commercial use as offices but the exterior is maintained in its original style.
